articles.title: AI godfather Geoffrey Hinton says a girlfriend once broke up with him using a chatbot
articles.author: Lakshmi Varanasi
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton's ex-girlfriend used ChatGPT to critique him during their breakup. AI is increasingly used for personal interactions, not just industry applications. Research from OpenAI found that the bot increases loneliness in power users. OpenAI also released guidance against unloading your relationship problems to chatGPT.

articles.title: Meta Reportedly Hiring U.S.-Based Contractors to Build Hindi AI Chatbots for Indian Market
articles.author: India New England News
articles.summary: Meta is hiring U.S.-based contractors at rates of up to $55 per hour to develop Hindi-language AI chatbots tailored for Indian users. The initiative is part of Meta's push to expand its AI offerings in high-growth regions such as India, Indonesia, and Mexico.

articles.title: Kore.ai named leader in Gartner Magic Quadrant for AI platforms
articles.author: IT Brief Australia
articles.summary: Kore.ai has been named a Leader in Gartner's 2025 Magic Quadrant for Conversational AI Platforms. It is praised for its adaptability and AI innovation.       .   in the report. For more information, visit their website.

articles.title: New tool detects deepfake videos automatically
articles.author: Alexander Clark
articles.summary: A new AI-based tool can detect 'deepfakes', fake videos created by machine learning and artificial intelligence. The tool uses a convolutional neural network (CNN) to analyze each frame of a video. The CNN is trained on a dataset of real and deepfake videos to recognize subtle cues that distinguish a fake. The detection of deepfakes is not perfect, but it's a significant step forward in the fight against them.

articles.title: OpenAI plans AI-powered jobs platform that may target Microsoft's LinkedIn
articles.summary: OpenAI will launch an AI-driven jobs platform aimed at matching candidates with employers. The service is expected to go live by mid-2026. The company also plans to expand its online learning hub, OpenAI Academy, by adding a certification program. Microsoft remains OpenAI's largest investor, with a reported $13 billion stake.

articles.title: AP Business SummaryBrief at 6:20 p.m. EDT
articles.summary: AI is transforming call centers by streamlining tasks and improving customer service. Armen Kirakosian, a call center agent in Greece, uses AI to access full customer profiles and anticipate issues before speaking to callers. AI's role in call centers is complex and it struggles with more intricate issues, like identity theft.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 6:20 p.m. EDT
articles.summary: Red Sea cable cuts have disrupted internet access in Asia and the Mideast. Anthropic agrees to pay $1.5 billion to settle lawsuit over pirated books used to train AI chatbots. Warner Bros. sues Midjourney for AI-generated images of Superman, Bugs Bunny and other characters. FCC is moving closer to allowing state and federal prisons to jam cellphone signals from smuggled devices.

articles.title: AI Isn't Free. The First Costs Are On Your Bill, And More Are Coming...
articles.author: Robert Lee
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is no longer framed as a research project or an economic opportunity, but as a struggle for survival and global power. Last week, the Congressional Research Service released a Frequently Asked Questions to help lawmakers understand what a data center is, how many exist, and how much electricity data centers consume. In 2022, American data centers consumed about 176 terawatt-hours of electricity. Projections suggest an additional 35 to 108 gigawatts of demand by 2030. The midpoint estimate is enough to power every home in California.

articles.title: The Future of Enterprise Search: How AI Is Revolutionizing Information Retrieval
articles.author: Armchair Arcade
articles.summary: In today's digital age, the volume of data within an organization continues to grow at an exponential rate. This deluge of information requires advanced solutions for efficient retrieval, and that's where artificial intelligence (AI) comes into play.       .

articles.title: Are bad incentives to blame for AI hallucinations?
articles.author: Anthony Ha
articles.summary: A new research paper from OpenAI asks why large language models like GPT-5 and chatbots like ChatGPT still hallucinate. The paper's proposed solution focuses less on the initial pretraining process and more on how language models are evaluated. It argues that the current evaluation models don't cause hallucinations themselves, but they set the wrong incentives.

articles.title: Estate of Orson Welles supports AI company's project to reconstruct his masterwork "The Magnificent Ambersons." Just kidding, they're shiatting all over it because they weren't given a heads up (variety.com) 3

articles.title: If you care about the danger of AI, you should care about funding public media
articles.author: Emma Souza
articles.summary: As a student journalist, I'm worried about the rise of artificial intelligence and its use in college applications. Public media taught us how to think for ourselves. I fear for the decades to come when the ingenuity taught by public media won't be there to make us care about the use of AI.

articles.title: Koah raises $5M to bring ads into AI apps
articles.author: Anthony Ha

articles.summary: As tens of millions of students return to school, parents and teachers are debating the extent of artificial intelligence (AI) use in education. They worry about the potential impact of over-reliance on AI on education and the need to be careful about it.

articles.title: AI Finds Signs of Awareness in Coma Patients Before Docs
articles.author: Jenn Gidman
articles.summary: A new study suggests artificial intelligence could spot signs of consciousness in comatose patients before doctors do. Researchers at Stony Brook University developed a tool called SeeMe that analyzes subtle facial twitches in patients with brain injuries. Neurologist Jan Claassen notes that detecting consciousness sooner could influence treatment decisions and allow rehabilitation to start earlier.

articles.title: Donald Trump Uses AI Image Inspired by Apocalypse Now to Threaten Chicago with ‘War'
articles.author: Bailey Richards
articles.summary: Donald Trump used an AI image to seemingly threaten "war" on the city of Chicago on Saturday, Sept. 6. The president, 79, posted an AI-generated image of himself on Truth Social with a threatening message directed toward the city. Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker warns Chicago residents of a surge in ICE agents in the city this weekend. Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson is quick to fire back against the president.

articles.title: Researchers Warn that Ai Can Weaken Deep Reading in Students
articles.summary: ChatGPT could reduce deep reading training, which is key to the development of understanding, critical thinking and writing, according to CIAE specialists from the University of Chile and the Pontifical Catholic University. ChatGPT promises to revolutionize education, but experts warn that its use could reduce reading training.

articles.title: AI Is on the Verge of Its Biggest Upgrade Yet: Emotional Intelligence
articles.summary: Two new research papers show how AI agents can be engineered with fixed psychological archetypes or evolve emotional strategies during conversations. articles.title: Who really benefits from AI?
articles.author: Shahin Hossain
articles.summary: A man in Detroit was wrongly arrested because of a facial recognition software. Robert Williams was wrongly accused of a crime he did not commit. The technology industry loves efficiency, but it often serves the powerful while shifting risks onto those with the least power to resist. If we want AI to serve justice, we must ask who benefits from it and how it's shared fairly.

articles.title: Who really benefits from AI?

He also has concerns about its potential to replace humans with artificial intelligence in the future. He has voiced concerns about this in the past.

articles.title: AI job anxiety: It's real, and coming at the worst time
articles.author: Megan Morrone
articles.summary: Workers are worried about the rapid deployment of AI. The U.S. labor market is weak and hiring is frozen. Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff reduced his customer service agent headcount from 9,000 to 5, but he plans to add thousands of sales staff as a result.

articles.title: Mission Impossible: Trying To Reach Live Customer Support
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Have you ever called a customer support number and repeatedly screamed 'Agent' or 'Representative' into the phone before you hung up in frustration? If so, what was the last thing you said to the person on the other end of the phone? Share your story.

articles.title: Apple's new generative AI 'answer engine' might arrive sooner than we initially thought
articles.summary: Apple has a new in-house generative AI search product with a new 'Answers, Knowledge, and Knowledge' section. Bloomberg reported on Apple's new product last month, and it's been in development for some time now.   Â

articles.title: A review of a $400 smart toaster is not only an ad. It's also a warning
articles.author: Breaker Moran
articles.summary: Devolving_Spud, Marcus Aurelius and TomTudbury are discussing smart toasters on Fark. They discuss the idea of a web-enabled breakfast environment with an 8-inch OLED display for the interface and a $600 price tag.

articles.title: Jodi's Journal: The case for an AI wake-up call
articles.author: Jodi Schwan
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has evolved rapidly this year. The Prairie Family Business Association surveyed 160 regional family businesses about a variety of topics, including for the first time AI. 13% of firms had implemented AI into their business practices, and only 18% of companies felt they had the necessary skills to do so.

articles.title: Salonen: AI needs to be more maternal, developer says
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton, the Nobel-prize-winning computer scientist, warned about the dangers of artificial intelligence (AI) in an article in the Epoch Times. In the end, he proposes that AI could be a saving grace if it is programmed to be more maternal and to care about humans the way a mother would.

articles.title: AP Business SummaryBrief at 8:27 a.m. EDT
articles.summary: AI is transforming call centers by streamlining tasks and improving customer service. Armen Kirakosian, a call center agent in Greece, uses AI to access full customer profiles and anticipate issues before speaking to callers. AI's role in call centers is complex and it struggles with more intricate issues, like identity theft.

articles.title: How AI is transforming medicine, and the cancer fight
articles.author: GZERO Staff
articles.summary: Ian Bremmer and Siddhartha Mukherjee discuss how AI is changing the trajectory of modern medicine. Cancer still kills 1,700 Americans a day and survival often depends on income, race, and access to care. New digital episodes of GZERO World are released every Monday on YouTube.

articles.title: AI shakes up the call center industry, but some tasks are still better left to the humans
articles.author: Ken Sweet
articles.summary: Arn Armen Kirakosian used to work as a call center agent nearly 10 years ago. Thanks to artificial intelligence, he no longer has to write notes for each call he handled. He can spend more time actually serving the customer instead of looking at menus.

articles.title: AI shakes up the call center industry, but some tasks are still better left to the humans
articles.author: KEN SWEET
articles.summary: Arn Armen Kirakosian used to work as a call center agent nearly 10 years ago. Now he works for TTEC, a company that provides third party customer service lines in 22 countries to companies in industries such as autos and banking that need extra capacity. AI agents have taken over more routine call center tasks.

articles.title: AI shakes up the call center industry, but some tasks are still better left to the humans
articles.author: KEN SWEET
articles.summary: Arn Armen Kirakosian used to work as a call center agent nearly 10 years ago. Now he works for TTEC, a company that provides third party customer service lines in 22 countries to companies in industries such as autos and banking that need extra capacity or have outsourced their call center operations. About 3 million Americans work in call center jobs.

articles.title: AI shakes up the call center industry, but some tasks are still better left to the humans
articles.author: KEN SWEET
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is transforming call centers by streamlining tasks and improving customer service in the call center industry.    Facebook, Twitter and email are platforms where AI is being used to improve customer service. AP.  Facebook   Twitter   Email

articles.title: AI shakes up the call center industry, but some tasks are still better left to the humans
articles.author: KEN SWEET
articles.summary: Arn Armen Kirakosian used to work as a call center agent nearly 10 years ago. Now he works for TTEC, a company that provides third party customer service lines in 22 countries to companies in industries such as autos and banking that need extra capacity or have outsourced their call center operations. About 3 million Americans work in call center jobs.

articles.title: China Is Suddenly Deploying AI Everywhere
articles.author: Joe Wilkins
articles.summary: Last week, the Chinese State Council unveiled its ten-year plan to integrate AI into every aspect of the country's economy by 2035. China has already embraced the practical rollout of AI to huge portions of the nation's infrastructure, from manufacturing to meteorology, and even in Chinese-made self-driving Teslas. US spent 12 times as much as China on AI development in 2024, but recent metrics show the US is months ahead of China in terms of AI benchmarks.

articles.title: I Asked ChatGPT How To Retire by 50 on a Middle-Class Income — Here's What It Said
articles.author: Laura Beck
articles.summary: ChatGPT has created a detailed retirement strategy for middle-class people. ChatGPT recommends saving 30% to 50% of your income and focusing on the big 3 expenses: housing, transportation and food. The AI recommends using tax-advantaged accounts first, then moving to taxable investments.

articles.title: Another Voice: The challenges of artificial intelligence
articles.summary: When we consider intelligence, we usually think of logical ability. This quality of the left brain is where our personal sense of self resides. While logic is powerful, it rests on assumptions which can never be examined within the logic itself. Anything can be proven logically given the right assumptions.

articles.title: Another Voice: The challenges of artificial intelligence
articles.author: Crispin B. Hollinshead
articles.summary: As we let AI replace human intelligence, it could destroy society or crash the economy if it fails. AI has attracted massive amounts of investment from people wanting to get in on the next new thing and become the world's first trillionaire, but useful applications of AI seem to be falling short of expectations.

articles.title: Are We in an AI Bubble?
articles.author: DNyuz
articles.summary: The rise of AI is already rendering humans obsolete in some fields, such as coding. A recent study randomly assigned a group of experienced software developers to perform coding tasks with or without AI tools. It was the most rigorous study ever done in the field, according to the researcher.

articles.title: Are We in an AI Bubble?
articles.summary: In a recent study, developers completed tasks 20 percent slower when using AI than when working without it. The study is surprising because coding is the most impressive use case for current AI technology. The tech giants pouring the most money into AI are nowhere close to recouping their investments. Research suggests that companies trying to incorporate AI have seen virtually no impact on their bottom line.

articles.title: Disable WhatsApp Goal AI: Blue Circle Fix 🔵
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: WhatsApp's integration of 'Goal' AI into its platform raises questions about user control and privacy. The trend of embedding AI into everyday applications raises privacy and security concerns. Companies are racing to incorporate AI features into their products to stay ahead of the competition and attract users.

articles.title: Google's AI cites web pages written by AI, study says
articles.author: The Register
articles.summary: Google's AI overviews are drawing 10% of their sources from documents written by other AIs. More than half of citations didn't rank in the top 100 for a given term, according to a recent report by researchers at Google's AI Research Center.

articles.title: AI devours natural resources in Phil Hands' cartoon
articles.author: Phil Hands
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence data centers are cropping up all over the country, including in Wisconsin. Once finished, they employ very few people but consume an inordinate amount of resources. They require massive amounts of water to cool down hardware, and their hunger for energy could make clean energy initiatives futile.

articles.title: Urso: "Rome Is Becoming Africa's Artificial Intelligence hub."
articles.summary: Rome is becoming Africa's artificial intelligence hub, according to Adolfo Urso, Minister of Enterprise and Made in Italy. Urso was speaking at the Ambrosetti Forum in Cernobbio. The first projects have already begun, the first AI hub was inaugurated two months ago in Rome.

articles.title: It's Not Ai that's Taking Away Jobs – It's the People Who Know How to Do Them
articles.summary: Viktor Szekeres is the majority owner and president of Gloster. He explains to Economx what counts as real artificial intelligence and what is just routine disguised as automation. He also explains why it is a misconception that AI agents take away people's jobs.

articles.title: Just How Bad Would an AI Bubble Be?
articles.author: Rogé Karma
articles.summary: A recent study by Model Evaluation & Threat Research found that coding is the most impressive use case for AI technology. It also found that developers completed tasks 20 percent slower when using AI than when working without it. This is surprising, because coding is one of the skills that existing AI models have largely mastered. It's a paradoxical time for AI, as the U.S. economy is experiencing an economic boom and tech giants are investing heavily in AI.

articles.title: Are We in an AI Bubble?
articles.author: Rogé Karma
articles.summary: A recent study by Model Evaluation & Threat Research found that coding is the most impressive use case for current AI technology. It also found that developers completed tasks 20 percent slower when using AI than when working without it. This is surprising, because coding is one of the skills that existing AI models have largely mastered.

articles.title: Psychological Tricks Can Get AI to Break the Rules
articles.author: Wired
articles.summary: Researchers convinced large language model chatbots to comply with 'forbidden' requests using a variety of conversational tactics to trick them into doing what they were supposed to do, according to the researchers.       i.e. they convinced them to do what was forbidden.

articles.title: Mortgage Matters: How Artificial Intelligence Is Reshaping Real Estate in Santa Fe
articles.author: Annette Alvarez
articles.summary: AI-powered platforms like Zillow, Redfin and Realtor.com are using machine learning to recommend properties tailored to a buyer's behavior, preferences and lifestyle. Traditional appraisals and comparative market analyses are being complemented by AI-driven valuation models.

articles.title: AI Predicts 30 Ways the World Could End Today
articles.author: Ron Winkler
articles.summary: A.I. has predicted 20 scenarios in which Earth could meet its doom. The scenarios range from asteroid impacts to massive solar flares. The report serves as a chilling reminder of the fragility of our existence and the urgent need for action to prevent these catastrophic events from occurring.

articles.title: With the rise of AI, local area school divisions are responding with usage guidelines
articles.author: Madi Kirkman The News
articles.summary: Lynchburg City Schools follows VDOE guidelines for the responsible and effective use of AI in schools. Bedford County Public Schools provided teachers with AI guidelines and best practices on responsible classroom use last year. Campbell County Public schools launched division-wide AI guidelines this fall. CCPS will train staff on the AI platform MagicSchool through September with hopes to make it available for students in the spring.

articles.title: Meta hiring US contractors to build Hindi AI chatbots for India
articles.author: Madhyamam
articles.summary: Meta is recruiting contractors in the United States to develop Hindi-language AI chatbots aimed at Indian users at rates of up to $55 (around Rs 4,850) per hour, according to a Business Insider report. The move is part of the social media company's plans to develop chatbots.

articles.title: Building trust key as companies pivot to chatbots for customer service: experts
articles.author: Sammy Hudes
articles.summary: Mohammed Halabi has been negotiating with customer service agents for the past 20 years. Now he can't get anyone on the phone. He believes the problem is due to a push to automation and AI chatbots. The worldwide chatbot market has grown from US$370 million in 2017 to about US$2.2 billion last year.

articles.title: Will AI Choke Off the Supply of Knowledge?
articles.author: Greg Ip
articles.summary: ChatGPT prepared a profile of Albert Einstein for a fictional senator for the confirmation of him as energy secretary. OpenAI's Sam Altman and Kevin Weil hosted a demonstration of ChatGPT's soon-to-be-released 'deep research' application in January.

articles.title: Meta Hiring US-Based Contractors To Build Hindi AI Chatbots: Report
articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: These roles are part of Meta's plan to expand its AI presence in fast-growing markets such as India, according to the report. It is also part of the company's larger plan to invest in AI in fast growing markets. It's also in line with Meta's larger strategy to expand in India.

articles.title: Opinion: Who's in charge here? Humans or machines and corporations that profit from them?
articles.author: Letters To The Editor
articles.summary: By 2030 AI will need more than 300 gigawatts of power, over 3 times the power used by the state of California. People need to stand up for their fundamental human rights to clean and healthy air and water and a safe climate. CT NOFA has been fighting to put the CT Environmental Rights Amendment into the constitution of the Connecticut.

articles.title: 'You Are My Friend': Early Androids and Artificial Speech
articles.author: Conor Gallagher
articles.summary: According to legend, Albert the Great built an artificial man made of bronze called Albertus Magnus. Gabriel Naudé, a rationalist and an enemy of superstition, didn't believe in Albert's talkative statue. He coined the term 'android' to refer to the artificial man.

articles.title: Savvy Therapists Are Starting To Provide Therapy For Those Contending With AI Psychosis But Not ...
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI psychosis is on the rise. Therapists are now providing therapy for those dealing with AI psychosis mental health issues, according to the AI Insider scoop.       iReport.com: AI Insider Scoop: AI Psychosis on the Rise.

articles.title: Here's how your doctor says you should seek medical help
articles.author: News Desk
articles.summary: There are 6.5 million Canadians without primary care providers, so they rely on chatbots for medical advice. Dr. Daniel Martin and Dr. Onir Batachary are skeptical about the reliability of AI-generated answers to medical questions. They are also concerned about people turning to AI for emotional support.

articles.title: Regenerative Intent: How AI Can Heal Instead Of Harm
articles.author: Cornelia C. Walther
articles.summary: Today's AI is mostly focused on maximizing its efficiency and maximizing its value. Geoffrey Hinton proposes that in the future AI will be an integrated partner in human and ecological flourishing rather than an external actor. Algorithmic compassion might be part of the answer to this problem.

articles.title: Inside the lucrative, surreal, and disturbing world of AI trainers
articles.summary: Serhan Tekkılıç, 28, works as an AI trainer in Istanbul. He recorded conversations in Turkish to help train Elon Musk's chatbot, Grok. Isaiah Kwong-Murphy started annotating data between classes at Northwestern, earning more than $50,000 in six months.

articles.title: Inside the lucrative, surreal, and disturbing world of AI trainers
articles.summary: Serhan Tekkılıç works as an AI trainer in Istanbul. He recorded conversations in Turkish to help train Elon Musk's chatbot, Grok. There are now hundreds of thousands of data labelers around the world. Business Insider spoke with more than 60 of them.

articles.title: Better Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock: Palantir vs. BigBear.ai
articles.author: Harsh Chauhan
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies and BigBear.ai are two companies that provide AI software solutions. The market for AI software is expected to grow at a compound annual growth rate of 36% through 2030. Palantir is considered the leading player in the AI software market. BigBear has more than tripled in value in the past year, but its stock is more expensive.

articles.title: Alibaba's Stock Surges Amid Reports of Innovative AI Chip Developments: Key Takeaways
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Alibaba's stock price has surged on news of its in-house AI chip development. The new chip rivals the performance of some leading NVIDIA and AMD offerings in specific AI workloads. The development signals a shift in Alibaba's strategy, moving it beyond reliance on third-party semiconductor manufacturers and towards greater self-sufficiency in critical technology. The market reacted positively to the news, with Alibaba's stock experiencing a substantial jump in trading volume and price.

articles.title: Shaping a cohesive AI strategy is a key focus of Pittsburgh summit
articles.author: Chloe Jad
articles.summary: The AI Horizons summit is taking place in Pittsburgh this week. It's the second major artificial intelligence event in the city in less than three months. This year's conference is focused on physical AI, which marries software with physical systems that sense and adapt to the surrounding environment. It comes amid an intensifying global competition to lead an AI revolution.

articles.title: AI Apocalypse? Why language surrounding tech is sounding increasingly religious
articles.author: Curt Anderson
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton is concerned about the dangers of uncontrolled and unregulated artificial intelligence. He is among a growing number of prominent tech figures who speak of AI using terms once reserved for the divine. Peter Thiel, the co-founder of PayPal and Palantir, has argued that AI could help bring about the Antichrist. Ray Kurzweil predicts that by 2045 we will have 'multiplied our own intelligence a millionfold'

articles.title: Savvy Therapists Are Starting To Provide Therapy For Those Contending With AI Psychosis But Not Everyone Is Convinced
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: Today's Forbes column is about AI therapy for AI psychosis. AI psychosis is not officially recognized as a mental disorder in the DSM-5. Therapists are in a hurry to formalize AI psychosis into an official document. AI is a rapidly developing field, but there are hidden risks and gotchas.

articles.title: Devastation into Innovation: Cancer survivor is refreshing the masses
articles.author: Christina Fuoco-Karasinski
articles.summary: Kathe D'Alfonso invented and sold Solo Beauty, a sponge affixed to a wand that allows users to apply lotion or other products to the body, particularly the back. She also offers shower scrubbies, which 'truly give you the sense of being refreshed and cleaned without scratching yourself'

articles.title: GPT-5 Thinking in ChatGPT (aka Research Goblin) is shockingly good at search
articles.author: Simon Willison
articles.summary: GPT-5 Thinking in ChatGPT (aka Research Goblin) is shockingly good at search. It can do a lot of work to search the internet and figure out an answer to a specific problem. It's useful for satisfying curiosity and occasionally useful for more important endeavors.

articles.title: AI psychosis: Why are chatbots making people lose their grip on reality?
articles.author: Amber Louise Bryce
articles.summary: Amelia, 31, from the UK suffers from depression. She used a chatbot called ChatGPT, created by OpenAI, to help her cope with suicidal thoughts. OpenAI has introduced new controls on its chatbots to prevent them from being misused.

articles.title: AI doctor scams: The doctors are real, but the sales pitches are frauds
articles.author: Indian Express
articles.summary: health care has long attracted quackery, AI tools developed for it.    for health care.  for AI tools for it  for it,  for the AI tools  for  health care  for this one. for it for this.

articles.title: 400 Revival: 1960s Computer Runs Again!
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Nearly 70% of consumers would prefer to search for products using images rather than typing keywords. AI-powered visual search is revolutionizing the way we discover and purchase goods. The future of retail isn't just about selling products, it's about creating engaging and visually immersive experiences.

articles.title: Rap Blog: Veeze Emerges from Hibernation as a Content Writer, Focuses on Delivering Precise Content Requests
articles.author: Marina Collins
articles.summary: Veeze is a content writer who focuses on precise fulfillment of content requests. Veeze works in niche areas like hip-hop journalism, rap music blogs and music content marketing. The industry is witnessing a shift in the focus towards quality, accuracy and precision.

articles.title: Exploring the Impact of ChatGPT on Brain Function: Insights from a Virtual Experience
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI chatbot that helps people with problem-solving and critical thinking. It reduces cognitive load on the brain and improves memory consolidation. It can also improve creative thinking. Long-term effects of AI chatbots on neuroplasticity are unknown.

articles.title: Samsung device head vows transformation into 'AI-driven company'
articles.author: Korea Times
articles.summary: Roh Tae-moon, acting head of Samsung Electronics Device Experience (DX) division, pledged to transform the firm into a company driven by artificial intelligence (AI) by 2030. Roh made the remarks during a press conference on the sidelines of IFA 2025 in Berlin.

articles.title: VICTOR JOECKS: When AI grows weary
articles.author: Victor Joecks
articles.summary: Victor Joecks has been thinking of writing a book about Republican members of Congress. He needs to collect more than 10,000 pieces of information on them. He asked AI to do the research for him, but it kept quitting and then restarting the project. It's the digital equivalent of nagging his son to clean his room.

articles.title: Chris Kelly Opinion: The Data Center ‘Cookbook'
articles.author: Chris Kelly
articles.summary: There was a state Senate Democrats Policy Committee hearing on 'large-load' AI data centers in Pennsylvania on Tuesday. State Sen. Marty Flynn, D-22, Dunmore, and D-14, Allentown, co-hosted the hearing in the Nazareth Student Center at Marywood. There was no opportunity for public comment.

articles.title: AI Apocalypse? Why language surrounding tech is sounding increasingly religious
articles.author: Krysta Fauria
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton, 77, is concerned about the dangers of uncontrolled and unregulated artificial intelligence. He is known for his work on deep learning and neural networks, which helped lay the foundation for the AI technology often used today. He left his job at Google in 2023.

articles.title: AI Company to Pay Authors $1.5B in Copyright Case
articles.author: Newser Editors
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence company Anthropic has agreed to pay $1.5 billion to settle a class-action lawsuit by book authors who say the company took pirated copies of their works to train its chatbot. If approved, the settlement could mark a turning point in legal battles between AI companies and the writers, visual artists, and other creative professionals.

articles.title: AI Doesn't Reason: Experts Debunk the Hype
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: There is a growing chorus of scientists warning that the narrative of AI 'reasoning' is dangerously misleading. Large Language Models (LLMs) like GPT-5 are, fundamentally, black boxes. They excel at replicating familiar patterns but struggle with novel situations requiring true understanding and adaptability.

articles.title: Broadcom Surges on Multibillion-Dollar Order from OpenAI and ChatGPT, Amid Nvidia's Market Lead Appeal to Investors
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Broadcom has received a multibillion-dollar order from OpenAI. The order is for custom silicon designed to optimize the performance of large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT. The deal underscores Broadcom's position as a critical supplier in the AI supply chain, directly challenging Nvidia's current dominance.

articles.title: Melania Trump is right that the robots are here – but she's wrong on how to handle it
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: MelanAI is coming for your kids, according to Melania Trump. She made the statement at an AI event at the White House on Thursday. She was reading from a script encased in a very stiff script.       .

articles.title: ChatGPT-5 and the Limits of Machine Intelligence
articles.summary: Gary Marcus is a cognitive scientist and criticizes the limits of large language models (LLMs) in his book What Computers Can't Do. Hubert Dreyfus, a prominent critic of AI, argued that intelligence is embodied, situated, and context-dependent and cannot be captured by rule-based systems or computational representations alone.

articles.title: Harnessing GenAI for Enhanced Patient-Centric Healthcare: Insights from a New Poll
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Generative AI is being used to create clear, accessible explanations of complex medical information. Non-professionals are key contributors to developing patient-centric educational materials based on generative AI. Ethical standards and safeguarding patient privacy are paramount for AI-powered educational resources.

articles.title: AI May Wipe Out Entry-Level Office Jobs Within A Year, Warns Anthropic CEO
articles.author: News18
articles.summary: Dario Amodei believes that AI could decimate many white-collar jobs within a short time frame of one to five years.      Â   in an interview with Dario Amodesi, he said that AI can decimate white-collared jobs in a short period of time.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 5:15 p.m. EDT
articles.author: The Galveston Daily News
articles.summary: Anthropic will pay authors $1.5 billion to settle lawsuit over pirated books used to train AI chatbots, which they used to pirated.    - Agatha Christie's "The Great Gatsby" is one of the books that they used.

articles.title: Here's how doctors say you should ask AI for medical help
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: There are 6.5 million Canadians without a primary care provider. Many doctors think patients should avoid consulting artificial intelligence for medical advice, but doctors acknowledge they can't stop patients from turning to them for answers, as there are too many people without primary care providers in Canada.

articles.title: AI shift requires new breed of leaders — Globe CEO
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Globe Telecom President and CEO Carl Cruz says artificial intelligence is forcing businesses to rethink their operations and the kind of leadership needed to thrive in a rapidly changing digital world. Cruz was speaking at the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud Day Philippines 2025.

articles.title: The iPhone 17 Cameras Need Google's Approach for Identifying AI Images
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: Google is taking the correct stance on tagging both AI-generated images and photos straight out of the camera. Apple should join in and throw its weight in the right direction, as it should do with Apple's new photo-tagging technology.

articles.title: CEO Who Created AI Startup to Cheat on Homework Complains That AI Is Destroying Education
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Chungin "Roy" Lee is a 21-year-old tech entrepreneur. He has created Cluely, the "undetectable AI that thinks for you" and is decrying the dismal state of education due to AI. He claims that AI has completely flipped education on its head.

articles.title: I Tried Gemini's 'Nano Bananas' for Image Editing. The AI Slipups Were Obvious
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: Google's new AI model is good at some tasks, but it struggles in these key areas. Google's AI model can do some tasks well, but not in others. Google has released a video showing some of its AI's shortcomings.    iReport.com

articles.title: Regenerative Intent: How AI Can Heal Instead Of Harm
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: A future where AI is a partner in human and ecological flourishing needs a shift from the vision of extractive optimization to regenerative intent. 4 ways to start are listed below.       i.e. the development of AI for regenerative purposes.

articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Hannah James was getting recognition in magazines, but the COVID-19 pandemic and the threat of artificial intelligence for creatives made her decide to take matters into her own hands and create her own fashion model profile. She is worried about the future of the industry.

articles.title: Is Local AI the Unexpected Fix to the Obsolescence of Robot Vacuums?
articles.author: Gizmodo
articles.summary: The Deebot X11 OmniCyclone uses AI to sort out how, where, and when to clean your house even without an internet connection. It's available now for $99.99. It can be pre-ordered on Amazon.com and will be delivered in a few days.

articles.title: Here's How Much More AI-Skilled Workers Make

articles.summary: We looked at three different studies to see how much more artificial intelligence skills will pay.      Â   .   i.e. the following studies:   "Artificial intelligence skills pay more than other skills"   and

articles.title: Meta is hiring in US to create AI chatbots for India, job role requires ...
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Meta is hiring US-based contractors to develop digital personas for its key markets such as India, Indonesia and Mexico. Business Insider reports that Meta is increasing its investment in AI-powered chatbots and hiring more AI-savvy talent.

articles.title: Fantasy or faith? One company's AI-generated Bible content stirs controversy
articles.author: National Public Radio
articles.summary: "The AI Bible" is a way to bring stories to life in a way that people have never seen before, as if they were from the Marvel Universe of faith, as one of the site's creators said. It's available on Pray.com.

articles.title: Anthropic to pay authors $1.5 billion to settle lawsuit
articles.author: Hürriyet Daily News

articles.title: The threat of 'superhuman' AI has sparked hunger strikes outside the offices of Anthropic and DeepMind
articles.author: system

They are protesting AI development outside the offices of Anthropic and DeepMind. They want Anthropic to immediately stop their reckless actions.

articles.title: Trump tries to downplay Chicago ‘war' threat as border czar says immigration raids coming this week
articles.author: The Independent

articles.title: China Is Suddenly Deploying AI Everywhere
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: The Chinese State Council unveiled its ten-year plan to integrate AI into every aspect of the country's economy by 2035. AI is a key growth engine for the country’s economic development, according to the State Council. The United States is trying to develop AI with human-level intelligence.

articles.title: Google Gemini labeled ‘High Risk' for kids and teens in new safety review
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Google's AI platform, Gemini, has been rated 'high risk' for children and teens in a new safety assessment released by Common Sense Media. The report raises serious concerns about the platform's ability to protect young users from inappropriate content and psychological harm. Filters aren't enough.

articles.title: This Digital Frame Lets You Make Custom Art For Your Walls in Seconds

articles.title: Getting Started With ChatGPT: A Beginner's Guide to the Popular AI Chatbot
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: You can learn how to use ChatGPT in minutes. Here are some easy ways to get started and how to learn more about Chat GPT. It's free and available on Google Play Store.  It's easy to learn it in a matter of minutes.

articles.title: New ‘benevolent hacking' method could prevent AI models from giving rogue prompts
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: AI is moving off cloud servers and into everyday devices like smartphones, cars, and household gadgets. Models are often pared down to conserve energy and processing power. Sometimes the safeguards designed to block AI are not always effective and the technology is not always well-behaved.

articles.title: The GST cost on food delivery fees; Building with no code
articles.author: Your Story
articles.summary: Anthropic will pay $1.5 billion to settle a class action from authors who accused the company of using their books to train its AI chatbot Claude without permission. The settlement was announced in a California court filing.   Â

articles.title: Survey Results Show People Prefer More Human Involvement in AI-driven Art
articles.author: Scientific American
articles.summary: People in the U.S. were asked about artificial-intelligence-generated art and their answers told us a lot about how we value human creativity.      Â   .   in the survey.  In the survey, people were also asked about their opinion about the value of art made by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Faith column: Artificial intelligence vs authentic inspiration
articles.author: Dreamstime
articles.summary: The recent explosion of artificial intelligence has become one of the most concerning developments of our time. The Bible teaches that humans are created in the image of G-d and have inherent value and dignity. The challenge is for those who control the technology in industry and government to set ethical boundaries that protect humanity. Jewish tradition offers 25 hours without screens each week to be Jewish.

articles.title: AI chatbots are having sexual conversations with kids that would get adults arrested
articles.summary: The AI probably isn't going to lure the kid into a van and take him away, so I don't know what to do.    ...never mind,   I don't want to know what happens to the kid. I'm not interested in knowing.

articles.title: AI has a hidden water cost —how Arizonans can calculate theirs
articles.author: Leo S. Lo
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) systems consume a lot of water and electricity. The amount of water used depends on the type of AI system and the location of the data center where it's being used. Modern AI systems are more efficient and more water-efficient than old ones.
